edu.bismarckstate.shortestpathhelper.movement

Class RobotMovement

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.bismarckstate.shortestpathhelper.movement.RobotMovement

  • public class RobotMovement
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to move the robot in simple ways will load a file to setup the robot for correct movement.
    Author:
    midpipps

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RobotMovement()
      Default Constructor uses the default file name of robotsetup.rbt
      RobotMovement(java.lang.String fileName)
      Used for custom robots.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobotMovement

        public RobotMovement()
        Default Constructor uses the default file name of robotsetup.rbt

      • RobotMovement

        public RobotMovement(java.lang.String fileName)
        Used for custom robots.
        Parameters:
        wheel - The name of the file holding the wheel diameter. Just put the wheel diameter in the file, nothing else.
        trackW - The name of the file holding the track Width. Just put the track width in the file, nothing else.

    • Method Detail

      • isDiffPilotOk

        public boolean isDiffPilotOk()
        Checks if the diffpilot was created correctly
        Returns:
        true if diffpilot was created ok false if not

      • move

        public void move(MovementInstruction move)
        Moves the robot according to MovementInstruction
        Parameters:
        move - The instruction you want to send. Should have a direction and distance. Will face the direction (north south east or west, or 0 to 360) and move the distance you send.

      • getFacing

        public double getFacing()
        Returns:
        The direction (in degrees) the robot is facing. 0 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, 270 = West When the robot is started the direction it's facing is considered north until reset.

      • setFacing

        public void setFacing(double facing)
        Parameters:
        facing: - The direction you want your robot to 'think' it's facing. 0 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, 270 = West When the robot is started the direction it's facing is considered north until reset. DALE AND TUCKER WARN: It's best to probably not change it's facing to avoid confusion, but hey you're in charge.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A string version of the class will show facing in N E S W or number of degrees depending on where the bot is facing.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
